newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Sentrachem unit in $85 mln share issue.
newsitem.headline: Sentrachem unit in $85 mln share issue.

text.p: Sentrachem's wholly-owned subsidiary Seetrade Ltd, has issued $85 million compulsory convertible preference shares to refinance a bridging loan, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.
The transaction, which was underwritten by French bank Societe Generale, was effective August 30, it said.

"The equity placement has been arranged to re-finance the 12-month bridging loan raised at the time of Sentrachem's acquisition last year of Hampshire Chemical Corp, the U.S. speciality chemicals company," the company said.
The preference shares would be convertible into Sentrachem Global Depositary Receipts (GDRs) over three years, at Sentrachem's option or a longer period by mutual agreement.
The issue of GDRs would be at market related prices at the time of conversion, Sentrachem financial director Norman Kennelly said.
He said the issue enabled Sentrachem to secure long-term equity finance at improved rates and improved the capital structure of the balance sheet while significantly reducing gearing.
